comment: Without the August Connect Wi-Fi Bridge automation tools that are described in the "Works With" Menu of the app cannot fully function. I think it's useful for:1) Airbnb - because my guests get lock codes instantly (hence: instant book with instant check-ins).

It works, but as others have said... Not well. I had read about the connectivity issues but hoped they had been fixed.They haven't... Even though my router is in a line of sight to the connect and it's only 15-20 feet away, the connect could not find it.

I love my August locks and really wish that my HomeKit Hub would have been sufficient to keep my locks synced but as hard as I tried, there was no way around buying the bridge to ensure out of home operation. It is VERY disappointing that you have to have a bridge for each lock and it is disappointing that it must be so close to each lock. Yes, these points are made clear by August up front. It would seem like they could do a better job with it. Besides, at some point I will have zero outlets left in the house. I do not like the fact that it required the bridge to link to both my Google Home devices and to my Alexa devices. I do not like the fact that you must use a verbal code to unlock the door with either Google or Alexa — especially since anyone in earshot will hear it and that, in itself, provides multiple security risks. I am beyond disappointed that after spending $75 for what at most should be a $50 item I learn after several long phone calls to customer service to learn that the integration between August and Google & Alexa “isn’t quite working just yet”. I had and still have high hopes for August. They just need to step up very quickly!

This device is almost impossible to easily add to your Wifi network and the app does not make it very easy. Took at least an hour of constant attempts before it finally worked. Bluetooth connection to the lock was very flaky even though it was literally 1.3 feet away. However, I had this device connected for several months and then suddenly it stopped working. I reset the device and wasted hours trying to get it to re-pair to the network. Nothing worked... endless fast green light flashing indicating it couldn't connect.Then the real nightmare started which was my interaction with "customer service". I quickly learned they have a simple strategy - do everything possible not to respond in real-time and ignore whatever the customer tells you in order to make the customer go away. Seriously, after describing the problem and the fact that I've gone through all of the troubleshooting, all I got back were emails outlining the trouble shooting steps. When I insisted on them honoring the warranty I got some nonsense back about being out of the 30 day RMA window for refund. After two more emails requesting them to honor the warranty, I got back the same email about needing to follow the troubleshooting steps.

I use this product for my rental properties on Airbnb and it's very useful to be able to open up the door for guests remotely when they can't.  I'd say about 80% of guests don't have any problem setting up the app on their phone, and they find the whole thing innovative and neat.  They can use their cell phone to open the door.I like that I can see who locks and unlocks the door and at what time on the August app.

Lock and Connect packages arrived an hour ago. Although there were thumb-holes in the packaging, for both lock and connect, I had to tear the packaging completely apart to get to the items - and I have very strong hands & fingers!  Once out of the package, the lock set-up was intuitive (ie, I didn't read the directions).  Then I downloaded the app, and set up the lock - pretty easy, except I don't like having to put my picture into their database for "security".  There was a little fussing to enter the security code they sent, because sometimes it would send to my phone, other times to email. Once I read carefully to which device the code was being sent, the system took the code.  Then I set up the connect, ie the wifi bridge.  Set-up was easy, but the connect is 6' 3" from the lock, and claims to have a bad Bluetooth connection.  The connect is not USB powered, it just plugs into an outlet, and I though I was fortunate to have an outlet 6+ feet from the lock.  But apparently one should have the connect much closer to the lock, so I may run an extension cord.  Crappy Bluetooth, in my opinion.  Nonethelss, the lock works from my phone using the August app when I stand a block away.  But so far, even though August and Alexa are supposedly linked, Alexa won't lock/unlock the door.  More later if/when I can get Alexa to work August.  Update 2 hrs later: lock now works with Alexa app (not sure why it suddenly started to work; maybe it just takes a while for everything to sync), but not so far with Alexa voice control. Update a day later:  Turns out I was asking Alexa to ask August to lock the door, per instructions.  However, by accident I found that it works by voice just by asking Alexa to lock the door - trying to get Alexa to ask August to do something does not work.  So much for instructions.  And as others pointed out, the doorsense doesn't work with metal-clad doors, since it is a magnet. Still 4 stars.

I mean, if you are committed to purchasing the August, then buy direct, because they won't warranty what you purchase through Amazon. :(  I had to learn this the hard way unfortunately.  I purchased the lock, connect and doorbell in June 2018.  At no point did any of the components work in unison.  First, the doorbell wouldn't power up.  August said it was our existing doorbells faulty/insufficient power source.  I hired an electrician to upgrade the 18v. wiring - he said it was ridiculous but did the work I requested anyway.  Still doesn't work.  Then, I decided to just use the doorbell camera as a makeshift 'security camera' set up on a table in my house.  Fine.  But, it doesn't even work anymore since I spent more money to upgrade our internet receiver.  It simply won't connect.As far as the lock, I had to have a new piece sent out and finally got it to work with the August Connect.  It worked from August - December and then we had a wind storm and the August Connect for some reason couldn't pick up the internet signal.  Like I said, shortly thereafter I upgraded and got the very best internet modem and package through Comcast because I really needed these three components to work simultaneously.  Well, the lock and connect are now working together.

The design and the concept is solid but the execution is poor. When installing this, like many have said, the Connect cannot find the August lock even though it is merely 5 feet away from my front door. Nevertheless, I’ve somehow managed to get this device to work. Interestingly, the device kept dropping its connection with the lock (I would get multiple notifications throughout the day with an arbitrary amount of downtime). Frustrating! Then all of the sudden after owning this for about 2-3 weeks, the connection has remained solid. When it works, it is brilliant. When it doesn’t, it is madly frustrating. Like many have said, this thing is need of a (many actually) serious firmware update. C’mon August folks, you guys need to stand by your products and give ongoing support. If you cannot do that, than the products should be discontinued.An expensive purchase for something unreliable. I would not recommend this product and suggest looking elsewhere for smart locks. Since I live in a condo with HOA that expects no changes to the outside, I was only limited to smart locks that kept your existing hardware. If it weren’t for that, I would have must definitely returned this.

I bought the August smart lock and it was awesome, I loved it. So I bought this item to connect to HomeKit and my security system. It worked great for about a week. Ever since, it’s constantly dropping WiFi and losing connection. I’ve factory defaulted both the connect and the lock around 5 times and same issues. It’s located 5 feet from my modem, 2 feet from a mesh WiFi device, and 2 feet from the actual lock. I even set up a separate 2.4ghz network JUST for the connect. No changes. This product needs software and firmware updates. I hope they update it soon or it’s going on eBay.Update 5/25/18

This company is going backwards... I used to be able to open my door remotely with only the August lock an the app, therefore I didnt really understood why this Connect thing existed but the past few months I wasnt able to unlock/unlock remotely with only the app and I thougth that maybe they just changed the software so that you would have to be froced to buy this which I did... Installing it was a problem since it only supports 2.4 and I had my phone at a 5Ghz network so after realizing that I had a few problems but was able to connect it an get it working... Now, first day out of my house and the thing will simply not connect... It just says "brigde unavailable" really dissapointed with this company...

I know some people have left good and bad references but I love this thing. I wish they had this when my kids were little. Having it unlock the door as I walk up to it is key. No turned on the auto lock as well not sure if that's as good as I have to be careful to always bring my keys or phone so I don't get locked out but when I forget to lock the house when I leave for work makes me wonder how often I used to leave my house unlocked by accident.  I also have a roav vnfornalexa in my car so can lock it by voice. From my car or unlock it with voice or phone so the kids can run back in. Like when we forget stuff.  If you have a busy life  this is key.  The bridge  I think should be part of the lock  it use my wink hub which it doesn't but an August lock is just the bomb. I even made it part of my " goodnight ". If then routine. So when I'm in bed I just tell Alexa goodnight and she shuts off the lights and locks the door.  I even could give a friend a guest invite so she could let herself in
What a thorough disappointment.An eco system with such promise - but just falls incredibly short.

After installing the August app and adding the Wi-Fi bridge to my network it was running smoothly. However I noticed after 1 week + of use, the bridge had a red light indicating that it was not connected. There was an issue with my internet router and after resetting it I had to re-connect the bridge. There lies the slight issue I have with it.The distance in order for the bridge and lock to work is very fickle to say the least. The bridge has to be very near to communicate with the lock however if a user does not have an outlet near their door then it's 50/50 if the 2 will communicate at all.

I tried it for a year and just can't deal with it anymore. It's nice when it works, but that's only 20% of the time. I have the August Connect Wi-Fi bridge less than 7 feet from the door. When it works, it is unlocking the door from the driveway. Unfortunately, the frustration of expecting it to work when I'm in a hurry or have my hands full and it not working is too much. The lock itself is much bulkier than expected. It looks out of place and when you have to lock/unlock it manually, the magnetic cover falls off in your hand. During the year, I did get one email from August asking for feedback. I gave the same feedback to them and got nothing in response other than "thank you for completing the survey". Still worked like junk after a few updates.

I have been using this August bridge to add WiFi capability to my August smart lock. My current lock does not support remote lock and unlock without the use of this bridge. If you install an August smart lock without native WiFi support, you can only unlock using Bluetooth while in the vicinity of the device. Keep in mind that this bridge does not add Apple HomeKit support. You are stuck using the August app to access lock features. It does have Auto-Unlock but this works by using Bluetooth.I would recommend this anyone BUT if you are an Apple user, I would recommend spending the extra money to add an August smart lock with native HomeKit support.

I bought the August Gen 3 Smart lock with the WiFi bridge, I have to say I love it.  Some recommendations for smooth install and dependable use.  Use Loctite and don’t over tighten mounting screws to deadbolt assembly; make sure tailpiece of deadbolt assembly is perfectly aligned with August lock; apply generous amount of heavy machine grease to moving components; make sure bolt is aligned to bolt face plate, weather striping can offset alignment (Dremmel tool would be handy to make perfect fit).  I did all this with mine, and it works perfectly.  I love the home/away function on the app; I just walk up to my door and it automatically unlocks for me; very useful when my hands are full.  Also, being able to check to see if the door is locked when I’m away from home.  Another perk is being able to check the history of when my door has been opened/closed, locked/unlocked (great for apartment maintenance, or forgetful girlfriend who occasionally leaves door unlocked).  Definitely grants peace of mind!  If your are not the handy type, I would recommend hiring someone to do the install for smooth operation.

To keep this short and simple I will say that the August Bridge is a must for the lock. That being said, it took quite a while to connect as there is a few flaws in the app during setup.It took me over an hour to get this connected. I had to do my own troubleshooting and discovered that when it's trying to connect with Wi-Fi I had to manually turn off and on the Wi-Fi on my phone. Once I did that, it finally worked.

This thing will not stay working. When it does work it is great. The problem is that it keeps loosing bluetooth. Every day when I check my bluetooth signal strength it says Poor. I reset the devices and the bluetooth signal says good. You have to do this everyday. I contacted August. You might as well contact a monkey at the zoo. They refuse to accept any responsibility for anything. As I told them a 12 year old with a Raspberry Pi can figure out bluetooth. But it seems these people can not. Do not buy this Dumb Lock!!!!
I have ORBI WIFI, so my WIFI is strong everywhere in my home.My issue with this WIFI connect is that it ONLY does one LOCK, even if you have two locks close to each other.  (this is why the 3 stars)

Item works as needed. Despite being 4 feet from the lock, the reported signal level (Bluetooth) bounces up and down (most of time the August app rates the Bluetooth signal as poor) although this doesn’t seem to effect it’s functionality.Update (5/9/13): I moved my connect so that is direct line of sight with the smart lock 30 feet away). Signal strength has gone up to excellent from low (when it was 4 feet away with a stucco wall in between). The connect is now plugged into a ups along with cable modem/router so theoretically it will even work during outages.

I bought these locks to allow for my home to be locked when away and yet to automatically unlock when family members came home. I purchased two locks (front and back doors) and one Bridge Connect  unit for wi-fi remote access, then found out during installation that a Bridge Connect unit is needed for each Lock in order to access wi-fi remote options, an added unexpected expense. The literature hypes the Auto Lock and Auto Unlock options of the locks. However, there is no mention that these options can only be used on one lock per home. Auto Lock only operates on a timer, locking the door at a specified time after the door is closed, just leaving home does NOT lock the doors. Auto Unlock is designed to unlock the door when you return - however it can only operate on one lock per home. If Auto Lock is enabled for the Front Door you cannot enter through the Back Door without using a key or opening the app, selecting the door and unlocking.  Although the Locks do work, the lack of integration of the locks and the limitations of the Connect unit make their usefulness extremely limited. I would strongly recommend you do detailed research on the capabilities/limitations of any wi-fi lock system before buying - this one fell far short of expectations.

While many people have complained about the lack of range and the ability to support only 1 lock at a time, I will offer reasons why this is so.  The locks themselves are designed to have a shorter range for 2 reasons: security and battery life.  Limiting the bluetooth range to 5-10 feet means that someone has to be at your door to access the lock, instead of being able to access it from down the street.  That also means that the Wi-Fi bridge can only be about 5 feet away from the lock in order for it to work properly.  Since most entryway doors are further than 5 feet apart, it means that it can only connect to one of them.  Keeping the range low also allows the batteries to last longer.Setup was fairly easy, although I wasn't too happy with where I had to end up placing the adapter, but it's not the end of the world. Anyone with a home built since 2005 should have an outlet close enough to their door that they shouldn't have to worry about the range issue.  Functionality works well, and Alexa integration was smooth.  It seems that many of the gripes that people had are due to the design of the lock, so do some evaluation beforehand and you should be alright.

I purchased the August Smart Lock along with the August Connect WiFi Bridge a few years ago to be used on a vacation rental home to help with check in and key handovers.The best things about this lock is the sleek look and ease of installation.

Really good product that works with the August deadbolt.  I bought the deadbolt from another place and found out that I needed connect to lock it with my phone so I found it on Amazon  cheaper than the August site.  Suggestion buy both the deadbolt and connect together from Amazon for about $159.  Now with both I can unlock my door while I'm away from home.  I can allow people to get in by inviting them to download and use the App.  Get this, the door unlocks when I approach my door and locks automatically when it shuts.  And most importantly I can still use my key to open the door!!  Awesome!

So this was the last piece to my smart home. I have a Harmony Hub and it said it works with my August Smart Lock.. the part they left out was that it works with other hubs of you have the connect. It was easy to get setup so I focus on what I liked about it and this review. I thought it was unnecessary, and shouldn't require a connect module for it to work with other hubs/Google/Alexa. Either way, connecting it was a breeze. It does have to be in vicinity of the August Smart Lock otherwise it won't be able to lock the door. Luckily, I have an outlet on an Uninterrupted Power Supply I bought that is close to my front door. I would've used an outlet, but i didn't want to run the risk of someone unplugging it from the outlet to charge a phone or something and then I'd be unable to control the door lock remotely. So plugging it into the UPS solved that problem for me. It works reliably about 99% of the time. It didn't work once, and that was because my internet connection had been reset. Other than that it works extremely reliably. I had a Home Chef delivery sent to me when I wasn't home and was able to call my neighbor and let him into my place to put the food away for me before I arrived home. It worked flawlessly. I saw some older reviews, and I think they've updated the software on the connect to the point where it is now very reliable, as those folks had lots of problems, but i think the updates fixed those issues.

I have a serious issue with the August system, and I'm hoping that future firmware updates will fix it... its slow. You'd think that someone would think "Hey, let's cache the last state the August lock was in that was sent to the Wi-Fi bridge, so if you look it up on the phone, it would be instantanous." However, this is not the case. Not by a long shot. The Pixel 2 XL has some odd issues with Bluetooth making it impossible to connect to the August lock, so I rely on the Wifi connectivity to make sure I can unlock the door when I need it. However, it takes 10 seconds for it to wake up the device (despite it requiring a wall connection), then 10 seconds to connect to the lock, and then finally it sends a command.There's some good stuff going on with August, but their software needs to be improved, significantly.

Bought in August 2018.  Connected initially, but have had constant issues since.  Used to be once a month or week it would notify me it was offline or I would try to use the lock remotely and it wouldn't work.  The last several months has been offline more than on.  I have a mesh WiFI system that is great.  I have a mesh satellite about 20 ft from the bridge and the bridge is about 10 feet from the lock.  All ideal.  Still... major connection issues.  All troubleshooting has done in the past is have me reboot and reconnect and when it works again, thats it.  Only to have it not work days later.  Maybe they have issues with mesh networks, but man its 2020, you should have a device that works with them as that is the future of wifi and has been around for years....  awful for a product you shell out $300 total for with the bridge to not even be able to use correctly.

I bought two of these; because, we can't control two locks with one of them.  That's my first major problem with these.  Not being able to control two or more locks is ridiculous.  The second major issue is they are not durable.  Both of them totally failed after being in service for a few months.  I would never buy them again.*** If you have a home hub, (Apple Homekit, Google hub, etc) you don't need the connect at all.  The locks work pretty much flawlessly with Apple Homekit.

Could not get this connected in a very connected house. Lots of devices including myq garage, Alexa, cameras. No luck getting this guy connected after about 20 attempts.The set up process would quickly leap to error message, saying it couldn't connect, try again. No troubleshooting available.

Requires 1 Connect for every lock for remote access. Can only lock or Auto Unlock one door per house.Not sure why fir either, especially since I found a place in house where Connect works with both looks.

This is an essential addition to the August Smart Lock.The installation and setup seem easy enough, however, the hidden tricky part is to find the sweet spot where the Connect can get a solid Wi-Fi signal as well as a good Bluetooth connection to the Smart Lock.

It's kind of sad really. My lock worked via Bluetooth without the bridge from anywhere in my house. Even a back corner through 3 walls over 40' away. BUT this bridge wouldn't pair with the lock from less than 10' away with only an open archway between them (see the picture I posted). And the bridge shouldn't be limited to a low power battery-saving mode like the lock is.PRO TIP: Use an extension cord for the bridge (or move the lock) so that they are only about a foot away from each other during pairing. Then put everything where you actually want it and cross your fingers.

After reading the horror stories, I was tentative about buying this with my August Lock but I'm glad I did.  After all, what good is a 'smart lock' in a 'smart home' if it isn't internet connected and you can only use it thru Bluetooth Low Energy from 5 feet or so?The Good:

First, I noticed the box I received had been opened and did not contain the setup instructions. I was, however, able to find the manual on the web without an issue.The first time I plugged it into a socket about 3' from the August lock itself and about 15' from my router, it immediately started blinking fast red. I unplugged it and plugged it back in several times without a change in status. I restarted my home wireless router and tried again with no changes. I discovered a button on front of the Connect and pushed it and held it for about 15 seconds. After doing that, it started blinking slow green and I was able to setup the device without an issue. After activating it, the additional features like auto unlock via GPS location, etc. became available. This button feature was not listed anywhere in the documentation so if you have the fast blinking red issue, give it a try. Another requirement when accessing the lock remotely is you have to press the wireless button from within the app in the upper right hand corner. This will then connect you to the lock and provide you the current status. Locking and unlocking it this way took about 3 seconds each time. Very nicely done!

I really like this lock. I can unlock it from anywhere although the furthest distance I’ve tried was 600 miles. I’ve used it to let the sitter in, housekeeper and family when I’m away.  It’s easy to change the battery.  Make certain you change it or else it will stop working and you’re locked out.  I believe there is a key but I’ve been diligent so not a problem. Love that my kids don’t require a key.  Those can easily be lost. I did require a locksmith to install, but I’m sure and one whose a handyman type could do it as well.Would buy it again!

This whole system with the August door lock is SO much better than our previous lock (whose name begins with K). We have had no problems at all with this lock over the 60 days or so that we’ve had it. Our old lock had problems almost from the start. When it finally started to randomly unlock the door, it was time to bite the bullet and replace it with something more reliable. So far, the August system does exactly what it’s supposed to do. It’s a tad expensive, but the security is worth it. The only issue I ran into with the installation was the supplied screws weren’t long enough. A quick trip to the home center solved that issue. No big deal.

I have a short term rental and used august locks for it. I was expecting an easy integration with airbnb as August claims and I was expecting the product to be reliable. unfortunately the reality turned completely different. Integration has a lots of bugs which are causing massive headaches for me. For e.g. each guest will appear as 3 separate entries in my guest list on the app and August cannot fix it. Few times I changed the guest access to an earlier time than my normal checkin time but the timing on the guest end did not update and the guest could not access the property, had to call me. Support is simply terrible, they ignore the questions, they don't read what is written, they don't do anything to fix their problems and they have zero integrations I could use when renting properties on other channels than airbnb.Lately I started getting troubles with this connect device - without any reasons it started to lose the connection few times per day. I contacted August and they said this:

I'm going to start off saying that i use a Google Pixel and haven't done anything to my phone. just bone stock.The connect works SOMETIMES. it doesn't do the auto unlock at all. something about that is broken and i've followed all the instructions and troubleshooting from the August message boards and elsewhere. It WILL work remotely but it definitely takes time. Overall i'm hoping updates will make this work flawlessly and promptly but i've seen where Apple devices work better than Android devices with August products. i'll have to check using my wife's phone, but until then, it works but not as well as it should.

Junk, I have it within 6 feet of both the lock and the wifi router and it says weak signal, I have tried putting it right at the router and also right by the lock and it still is no good, before the connect I had to be standing nearly right at my door before my phone would connect to the lock and now with the connect I have to be standing in the same spot and then go through the reconnection process, and I have yet to be able to use it remotely and when I ask Alexa to lock the door she says the August connect is not responding, so tell me exactly what good is this $78 piece of crap?

I bought this to utilize with the August smart lock, and it was a complete failure. Not sure if it's defective by design since so many people on here had the same issues I did, but it could not connect to anything. I even connected it to an extension cord brought it to within a foot from the lock but the Bluetooth would not connect to the lock even though my phone picked up the lock from the other side of the house. I reset it multiple times, after 2 hours of resetting and retrying different setups I gave up. A shame since the lock worked great with my phone but I bought this to remotely open my door so now I am returning both. I would avoid!

Works, but it needs to be pretty close to the August lock. We plugged it into an outlet within range of the door lock, but it kept failing to connect. THANKFULLY, we have an outlet right by the door that was less than a 1 foot away. This seemed to do the trick. Maybe there is some kind of technical interference due to the construction of our home and how radio wave move though the house... blah blah blah. All i know is that we were within the manufacture's recommended range from the door and the August Connect did not work so we lucked out by finding an outlet closer to the door. If this outlet wasn't there the whole investment would have been a waste.

Easy to setup through the app.  Works well.  Comes in handy when someone needs to drop something off or pick something up. Also, use it for friends and family to come by if we are out of town.  Super impressed by their customer service.  My connect failed, I emailed support, got a response within an hour asking a few basic questions and then offered a solution immediately.  I sent a screenshot of my purchase on Amazon, a quick video on my phone of my faulty device, and again within no time a new item was shipped. Love when a warranty is actually worthwhile.  Highly recommend this smart lovk system.

I bought 5 August Smart Locks (not the Pro model) along with 5 August Connects and works very well if the installation instructions were better written.1. The August app showed August Connect installation instructions which is cool but some instructions may be incorrect.

VERY HAPPY WITH THE LOVK AND THE COMPANY.We bought an August lock over a year ago and it didn't work well. It didn't have enough power to close a brand new bolt and the plastic adapter ended up breaking because the mechanism got out of sync. We were sooo frustrated and never expected this lock to work right.

It's cute, and it does establish a connection to my 2nd generation August lock, but it won't connect to my WIFI.I disconnected the lock from my front door and placed the lock, my Galaxy S9 and my 1 day old August Connect within 5 feet of my router and no cigar. The Connect failed to connect to my Linksys EA6900 dual band router and won't make a remote connect to my August lock even though the August app registers it and my lock on it's device list. Any idea's?

I, like many reviewers, have had my rounds with this wifi-bluetooth bridge. During initial setup the device protested that the bluetooth signal was not good enough anywhere that wasn't the outlet 7ft away straight ahead on the side of my kitchen counter. The tested locations included, an outlet 10 ft away, another 9 ft away hidden in the cabinet above my microwave, and three feet away through a standard wall. I left the device in the counter plug that made it happy for nearly one year. I would get a notification at an arbitrary time that the device had lost wifi connection, sometimes in the middle of the night/day. Not once have I had an issue controlling the lock remotely with this device. It has never disconnected at a time I needed it and always promptly reconnects. Now, I relocated the device to the outlet 9ft away that it didn't like about two weeks ago. I didn't ask if it liked it, I just left it there. No discernible change in function has occurred. The device notifications have been reliable and notified me both times Maintenance opened my apartment mid-day, when I wasn't home, without warning, to change my air-filter.

First, the good...  When it's working it is absolutely amazing.  When connected it does exactly what it says on the tin, I can access and receive updates from the lock from anywhere.  I have found the auto-unlock works better and the ability to use voice commands to tell the door to lock via Alexa (or ask Alexa if the door is locked) is very handy.  By default unlocking via Alexa is disabled, which makes sense.  Someone could otherwise literally shout through the door and tell Alexa to unlock your home.Now, minor issues; if you remotely lock your lock (or unlock it), the status doesn't change on the App for a good long while, even if the log shows it was completed successfully.  There was not good feedback on if the device locked or unlocked and when you can't see or hear the lock that is a bit disconcerting.  I also found the notifications don't always work but they are in the log of the app, I think this is an app issue not a service issue.

Just wanted to mention my experience with having the August Connect fail entirely, twice. The first time was 13 months after I purchased it. It was completely dead despite being plugged into an APC surge protector and suddenly stopped working one day despite no recent surge.However, August support was great and replaced it free of charge, even though it was a month out of warranty. I connected the replacement to a small UPS I now have near enough to my door. The second one just failed again, though I think it made it about 18 months this time.

Why did I wait so long to buy this?  It’s expensive for what it does and yes, I should have bought the kit which included it. I thought I could get away with using Samsung SmartThings, but what a mess that was. Once I got this installed, it works so much better than SmartThings. No matter where I am, I can easily lock the door. The geofencing now works perfectly when I come back home. Great device.

I got a Connect 1 1/2 years ago and it only worked intermittantly. I kind of thought it was our WiFi so just limped along with it until it finally just quit working.  I just bought a new one a few days ago and from the moment I plugged it in and installed it, this one JUST WORKS. Signal in identical location as my last one is reading full strength and Alexa voice command works quickly. I'd recomment that you don't struggle - if the one you bought doesn't JUST WORK then exchange it for another.
Is a review of the August lock, the bridge, and the app.Pros:

Linking the Connect to my August lock was a painless process that only took a couple of minutes. Initially the app warned me that the connect was too far away from the door and I would likely experience lags when trying to lock and unlock my door, but because that was the closest plug, I gave it a try anyways. Despite the warnings, it has worked instantaneously and flawlessly every single time single I installed it five weeks ago. I'm very happy with my purchase, and definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to add extra functionally to their August lock.

As description says, this will allow you to check in on August door lock when you are outside of bluetooth range.  I think this is essential item to have if you are installing August door lock.  With this, you can check in the status of the door lock and lock/unlock the door anywhere you have wifi or cellular data coverage.  I guess I have been lucky enough to not have any issues with this.  This is located within 3 feet of August door lock and after several months of use, we haven't had any issues.
This was delivered on time, and was was well packaged.I had tried other units but they were either too complicated or just didn’t pair with my ring doorbell, door locks.etc

EDIT: Since writing my original review, the device has begun to work much more consistently, specifically with regard to the auto-unlock function and speed of connection in the app. I can now count on the device to work as intended every time I return home. I've increased my rating to 4 stars (from 3, previously).Could not be set up using my Nexus 5x due to a firmware issue (apparently). Got it set up with a friend's iPhone, and it works well enough most of the time, but typically shows a weak Bluetooth connection to the lock despite being maybe 6' away (which is the closest outlet I have). Additionally, when opening the app, the wifi has to be turned on every time to connect to the device - it would be preferable to maintain a continuous WiFi connection to speed up the process (I'm assuming there's a technical reason for this, but I was a little disappointed). Once connected, it does do a pretty good job of controlling the lock remotely when away, and it will connect to other smart home devices. Does not improve lock connection speed when near the door (for auto-unlock, for instance), which is one of my main gripes with the lock itself.

This is necessary for the August smart lock. Bluetooth just isn’t enough unfortunately. I bought the Smart Lock because I came home to find that my teenager had left for school in the morning without locking the front door! It has worked wonderfully! I gave this wifi bridge one star for each lock that can be simultaneously connected to it. It works great, but it was quite an unpleasant surprise when I realized that you need one of these PER LOCK. Proximity to the lock was also a bit odd, with it not connecting to the device when it was plugged in a couple feet away, and then connecting when I moved it a few more feet back.

We bought these bridges to go with the August Smart Lock.  The bridge allows Alexa to operate the lock.  Note: Alexa will not unlock the door on command but she will lock it.  Makes sense - you wouldn't want a thief tell her to unlock the door and have her do it... The bridge plugs into an outlet and has to be within 15 feet or so of the lock, the closer the better.  This is the only inconvenience of the bridge.  Depending on where you install the lock, you might be limited in options on where to plug the bridge in.  The bridge was easy to install.  The August software, on the smart phone, walks you through it.  The bridge also has a reset button if installation doesn't work out well the first time.  The bridge was a necessity and we would have preferred not have to use it, but the door locks would not otherwise work with Alexa.  So, this is  a good bridge.  It isn't very big and is easy to use.

August connect allows you to control the August Smart Lock through the internet. It does this by connecting to your WiFi router and then using Bluetooth to connect to the lock. So the connect must be placed someplace that it can easily connect to the lock.Because it is a bridge and has to connect twice it is slow and not reliable. Many times I connect to the lock and when I click on the link option it will loose connection foring me to reconnect. When you click on the lock status to lock it, it will not change for a moment and look unresponsive. Remember your phone just sent the command through the internet to your router, which then sent it to your connect via wifi which will then connect to the smart Lock via Bluetooth. Then it reverses the process to send the lock command.  The August connect need patience to use.

Doesn't work. Connects just fine. (well sort of. Has to be in line of site and about 6 feet away from the lock to get anything other than a "poor" bluetooth signal. My phone can be 30 feet away in another room and connect to the lock via bluetooth, so I assume there's either an antenna problem or a very-poor-quality radio unit in the Connect). Doesn't work once connected, though. I do computer stuff for a living, so my guess is that the real problem is August's server. It's unlikely that the connect talks directly to your phone over your local network. Instead, it talks to a server that August runs out in the cloud somewhere. Your phone then connects to the same server over the internet. The lock is linked to the phone through that server. The behavior I'm seeing reeks of badly done server software, so it's probably not the physical device, but rather the lousy server-side software that the device uses to talk to your phone. Frankly, none of that matters if you can't unlock your door. It's the system that you're buying, not the physical device. August needs to hire somebody competent to rewrite their server-side system, though.

I'm tossing this lock & giving up the $300 I wsated on it. Read reviews to see how long people have owned these. Cool at first, yet in reality they stink.

Just like all the reviews, it is terribly difficult to connect to your wifi. But after trial and error, moving routers around, I got it to work in about 20mins. After it did its initial connection I was able to move my router back to it's normal place and the Connect+router+phone all worked seamlessly. This helps us unlock/lock our door from anywhere we have internet. Hopefully, August updates their connect to be more powerful and reliable, but for now, this will do.

The network option for accessing the August lock is less reliable than my Jaguar. I use this to ensure guests and tenants lock the door on their way out. Unfortunately, I might be able to see my door is left unlocked all day, but there's nothing I can do about it. The action to lock it just times out over and over most of the time. When it does work, there's a good 15-30 second delay. Frustrating.Edit: This thing hasn't worked to lock or unlock the door for a year 😂

I pre ordered this and never could get it to connect to mine or my neighbor's WiFi. I've been dealing with customer support since I got it.  They obviously care but I think their coding is just losey.  It's not working right out of the box like it ought to.UPDATE: The August support team really cares a lot about it working for me.  They kept on trying everything they could to help, even reading the manual for my specific router and recommending changes.  The only thing that finally made my LG G2 AT&T phone (using Straight Talk) was it updating itself to Android 5.0.2.  When it was running Android 4.0, it didn't work.  I like having the connect a lot and I use it over BlueTooth since frequently BlueTooth still fails several times before it finally connects.

Love this product. Was a breeze to install -- I simply plugged it in and opened the August app to connect it to my home network and August lock.The August connect allows for the August lock to be accessed and controlled over wifi. The lock is low energy bluetooth enabled nativley so the connect allows extension of control via Wifi. Enables you to check the status os the lock from anywhere and also remotely lock/unlock the device.

Works like magic.  I'm now using them in two locations and very happy with them. I use them with the keypad and love the whole system. August access has the  best customer support around.  Fast and effective.This in marked contrast to a company like Lockstate, which lock setup instructions were complex & inaccurate, and whose "customer support" required long wait times of 20-60 minutes just to talk someone-who often could not help.  Returned their lock in favor of my second August Access lock-which works like a charm.

This product is pretty good. I have an issue with the bluetooth "range" on it. I have the device plugged in maybe 6' away from the door. My Wi-Fi router is literally less than 2 feet away and I will occasionally get disconnected. I would think for the price that the team that develops this product would not have any issues connecting via bluetooth. I have aftermarket bluetooth speakers that I can be connected to from 15 feet away and not have issues. This product may not be worth the cost to some people, however 90% of the time it works for me and I like the functionality of being able to unlock the door for someone when I'm not home.

This bridge is the only way to make the August Lock work when out of range of Bluetooth. It works great as I can see the door’s status when not home. Your WiFi will affect its performance si be sure to have a strong signal. My lock works instantly when I give it the signal.

Signal gets killed by metal cover on August lock itself (magnetic metal plate in my case).  Guessing when they bench tested the radio in this thing it was next to a lock that was in pieces.  I can put this a few feet away and get bad signal regardless of orientation.  BUT, removing the metal cover plate from the august lock itself, signal strength shoots up +10-+15 over previous...  They built the lock so strong it keeps in/out Bluetooth signals!!!  I'm replacing the metal cover with a 3D printed one to see if the signal stays the same.  Nice lock... Too Nice!

The wi-fi bridge works well, but is not bulletproof. First, as I learned through trial and error, it has to be pretty close to the lock. Next, it has to be off to the side, not directly in front. Lastly, don't believe the videos on YouTube - locking and unlocking is not instant (it takes a few seconds to even connect to the system). Finally, I've never gotten the invites to work (we've tried on two different occasions). Still, even with quirks, I'd recommend it to friends and wouldn't hesitate to buy again.

When I first received it, it was tough to find a location that was optimal for it to connect.  Now that I found the proper location, it works great.  I think that it also had to do with updates to the app.  It now connects quicker over WiFi.  I definitely like it, as I've forgotten to lock the front door to my house several times.  I think it's a good purchase and kind of a necessity if you're away from your house and need to check the lock status.

I'm not a fan of August. Their locks cater to the iOS community, leaving over 80% of smartphones customers world wide in the dark. Even if you're lucky enough to have a compatible device, it isn't guaranteed to work.WiFi Bridge is VERY slow to connect. Generally takes 2 minutes or less, even if you are connected to your home WiFi. Quicker to open your door with a traditional key.

The August product line must have the best PR I’m the world. But in practice theses products just do not operate as advertized despite all the hype. Almost impossible to program if you want to be remote, slow functionality. I know we are at the beginning of the ‘smart home’ but this product line has a Long way to go.  And do not expect Any help from their support dept. on line or on the phone. Seriously seriously disappointed by the reality of this product.

After being that busy owner of a plastic surgery practice in two locations in the Dallas-Fort Worth area we noticed that the front office staff turnover required us to change our locks quite frequently or arriving early our surgical staff sometimes forgot their keys. Using this system we  are now able to circumvent rekeying the locks with staff turnover, inconveniencing a manager to come in early when front office staff would leave the keys at home and we are now planning on installing this on our vacation home that we use for Airbnb to replace our other smart lock. One of the best features is it creates a log of who has entered and allows you to set janitorial times so that access is limited

Easy to install, easy to use. It's a little irritating how close it has to be, but seriously it's a pretty cool way to allow people into your home from a great distance. It's also pretty great if you forget to lock your door and are in bed. Convenient and simple.

This does not work with Google Home.  August support has been ignoring me for days.Updated: one week later it started working after I removed and returned one of the locks.  It seems like they can only handle one lock and support voice commands.  Can't say for certain, since support never had any useful information.

This is a required accessory if you’re installing in August smart door lock and want to integrate it with Alexa and/or a SimpliSafe alarm system.I only gave it four stars because it has somewhat limited range; it must be plugged into an electrical receptacle close to the door in which you install the August lock. By close I mean about 8 feet.

Works great with its own app but the Alexa need some enhancement. The Alexa app Ariz out about every third time and also there’s no way to set up a schedule to make sure the doors locked when you’re not around says it’s unavailable in the Alexa group

Together with the August lock, I seldom have to reach for my keys, and I never need to give a key to houseguests, rather I add them as users from the app.I like that I can still use a key on the lock as a backup — although I’ve never needed it.

This thing makes the August smart lock so much better. Very nice to be able to use the google assistant to lock or unlock (with security pin) your door from anywhere with an internet connection. My only grip is that during initial setup, it said that the connection with the smart lock was weak and to try a closer outlet to avoid issues. The outlet is directly adjacent to the door without anything in between, and the physical distance between the Connect bridge and the smart lock is about 2 feet. It couldn't possibly be in a better location. It's also only about 6 feet from the router. So I just left it, and so far have not noticed any performance issues.

I am still mystified about why the August Lock & Doorbell Cam *should* work consistently, but don't.  This Connect is required to get the two pieces of equipment to work together.  After installation, they work great for four days or so -- many people have posted similar comments -- but starting on Day 5, nothing, I mean nothing, will get them to work consistently.  Mine worked early in the morning or late at night every now and then.  They never worked mid-day.  Never.  The scary thing was, my door would unlock, on its own unbidden, at odd times day and night -- with no notice.  I should charge August Tech Support for the hours of time we wasted trying to get their equipment to work.

The product interferes with my Ring doorbell. Once it’s connected the ring door bell stops working. I have to unplug it for the ring door bell to work again. After moving it about 12 feet away from the door, and reconnect it more time ( remove from account and did a new set up) both the ring door bell and the August bridge works fine.

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!I measured. I plugged in five feet two and a quarter inches away. Unobstructed. It wouldn't connect. I moved it to two other outlets in the room that were further away still didn't connect.  I finally plugged it into an extension cord and hung the extension cord on the doorknob right below the lock. It works that way. Don't waste your money

I never could get the bridge connected.  The lock installed and worked with the app, but this was a whole different animal.  I had a great WiFi signal, but even trying to connect with an extension cord held directly next to lock, and next to the router yielded nothing.  I’m disappointed.  The lock is on now but accomplishes nothing because without the bridge, it only operates with my phone adjacent to the door.  A key in my pocket would be faster.

Don't know whats up with the August connect , Wifi is excellent. But the Bluetooth starts at good, then moves to bad/poor. This is if I am right on top of the lock or 10ft away I always get the same results . Either the app is lying because I can remotely unlock the door and check status of the lock or there is something majorly wrong with these things. For 78.00 + bucks. I should be able to plug it in 5 ft away from the lock and it have at a minimum good signal at all times. My Alexa does work with it and I can remotely unlock/lock the door. If august even reads their views . Then they need to fix the range on the Bluetooth on this thing.

The lock it self is very nice. The company failed miserably with this addition. For one had issues setting it up in the app. The wifi adapter has to be literally to work feet away to work with a lock for Bluetooth capabilities . If you don't have a  power plug close enough , don't waste your time and money.. Another issue working with my internet connection, had issues syncing to my internet provider. Luckily had an apple amplifier to pair with. Wouldn't recommend this product to any one

Great filling have remote access to your house. Work as intended must people who have issues connecting check your wifi is not 5g. I haven't experienced any problems after properly configured. The auto open and close features work great is not perfect but works 97% of the time very accurate I must say. I like to add alexa do not unlock the door for you this functionality doesn't exist in alexa, the guy who stated is doing it is lying.

Terrible product. The remote connect barely ever works. Connect must be within range of the Bluetooth lock AND must maintain a powerful wifi connection throughout....or else it goes red and is as useless as if you never bought. Unless you have strong wifi connection throughout your home/apartment I would not recommend.

This is the second one I have had to buy, the first one lasted just over a year and was out of warranty, and I was not ready to give up on the August lock as I have put to much into my system. It works great and I am happy with the entire locking system and access pad, just wish the first one lasted longer for the price.

We purchased this a year ago. Outside of the latch being off center, an issue we had for months prior to getting this, it has been great. I don't even think we've changed the batteries yet. It's great when we unpack the car. The Bluetooth unlocks it so the kids can just run into the house while we unpack.Just make sure you keep the "router" plugged in. We took a trip to Chicago & my In-laws unplugged it & my assistant wasn't able to get into the house. We had no idea what was wrong. A week later while cleaning I noticed it unplugged.

After reading the reviewa for this system, my biggest concern was battery life of the lock portion.  I am almost 3 months in and still have not replaced them.  The WiFi bridge is not a critical component, but I bought it to see the lock status from anywhere.  This system was well thought out and works flawlessly for me.  I like being able to send out electronic keys and my actual keys still work.  Installation and setup were simple and took about half an hour including the lock.  The only negative thing I can say is that when you have it set to automatically unlock, it will do it even when I go in through another door.  Does not work with Windows Phone.

The hub is okay. It communicates a little slowly for my taste, average of 8-11 seconds to relay commands, but it works. Would prefer a better range on it, it only works out to about 15-20 feet from the door on the outside. To be honest had I noticed that the lock really isn’t compatible with Alexis (the hub is) I most likely would have purchased a different lock. And let’s be honest here, if something needs an object or device (like a hub) to translate for a system (ie Alexis) that something is not compatible with the system.

Works pretty well but the range is awful. Mine is in direct line of sight and about 4 feet away but the "Bluetooth RSSI" signal is always "bad". I've tried resetting everything and the signal has not improved at all. If you don't have an outlet right next to your door then this probably won't work for you.

I use the Wifi remote feature with my August Lock almost daily.  I give it 4 stars because this is the 2nd one I had to purchase.  The lock is going strong, but it seems that my first bridge failed, and I had to purchase a second.  They are the cheapest thing.

It works... some of the time.  But not reliable enough for dependable use and that is totally unacceptable for a security device.  Ours is five feet from the August, in an outlet that is at door handle height.  It has strong WIFI signal and no power issues.  BUT every so often is looses connections and is blinking red.  MOST of the time a simple power-cycle restores it, but that is not acceptable for a lock controller whose sole purpose is to work when you aren't at home.  Need work.  Did not send back because I am hoping it is something that an update can repair.  When it works, it is great.

It’s easy to install and set up. When it works, it’s great but it struggles to keep connected to WiFi and we spend a good amount of time fighting with it more than using it some days. When it’s working, it’s amazing though and has been a huge help if we’re out of town but have a pet sitter coming over or family that wants to use our house.

Worthless. August hounded me to buy this for my v1 lock and they will NOT talk. I have spent well over 2 hours trying to get them to connect but the app fails or says it cannot connect to my wifi. What a waste of money

As soon as I started using this my August lock stopped being able to lock. The door ajar feature has never worked which is the only reason I bought this. I am not sure if I have a faulty unit or what and do not have the time to deal with it. Extremely disappointed

After I received this I plugged it in and I messed with it for about an hour trying to get it to connect. The next day I called tech support with August and spent another hour on the phone we finally got it to connect two days later it is disconnected again it will not connect. This thing is pure junk. August really needs to revamp this thing

I always feel safe and reassured that the house has been locked.  Being able to check the lock when we are away is wonderful.  My children and grandchildren come and go without worry about keys or vides. We have had no problems.  In fact we' bought .my daughter one and she loves the fact she can on when the mis come and go.

Easy to set up and connect to August Lock and works pretty well.  A little slow and occasional disconnects but usually comes back online fairly quickly.  The problem is longevity.  After almost 18 months it quit working.  Warranty expires in 12 months.  I suggest buying the insurance because you will probably use it.  On the positive side, August Customer Service via email was quick and responsive and assisted me with an acceptable solution

I bought the August lock and connect bridge. My teenagers who are not easily impressed by technology are amazed at how cool and convenient this is. Super easy to install and get working. App works flawlessly. So many awesome features like auto lock and unlock. I also own a schlage sense lock - the August smokes it in every way. Like an iPhone the August just works. Easy interface and no glitches in setup or use. I want to outfit all my homes with this.

Before I moved from my apartment it worked good. Now that I moved to the new house it is unreliable. And less than 4 feet from the door/lock. The Bluetooth feature is bad, even at the last apartment.  It needs a firmware update. Something. The auto unlock of the smart lock makes the purchase of the lock worth the price. This connect device, as is, needs fixed.

The Connect is located less than 7 feet from the lock. There is a significant delay between trying to connect to the wi-fi bridge and when the lock itself responds. [Update] We changed our WiFi router and I had difficulty re-connecting the Connect to the new WiFi network. I called August Support and they helped me reset the Connect and the Lock. They emphasized that the Connect only works on the 2.4 GHz band (not the 5 GHz). Support was very helpful - I am satisfied with their service.

Works as desrcribed, must have for remote access of your August Lock 3rd Gen or August Lock Pro+These lock systems are the best, since you can access them from most Smart Home platforms, you still keep your keys, but have all the conveniences of a digital lock and full compatibility with August Doorbell and August added keypad.  I am immersed in August!
The only issues I am having with this is the response time and also twice it dropped off network. But great product. Cant imagine going back to keys... we've been keyless since Dec 2019

This doesn’t make a difference in wether or not the damn lock will open when I get home.  Sure I can manually unlock it from my phone but the auto unlock feature is why I purchased this lock and the bridge and it doesn’t work most of the time.  Extremely disappointed.

It’s really nice to be able to lock and unlock my door from anywhere and check to see if it’s locked.  The only downside is when the router goes out occasionally it doesn’t auto connect again and you have to run through the whole painful setup again.  The setup takes a long time too.  You need to switch your phone to the 2g network in order to set it up because it doesn’t support 5g.But all in all works well once set up.

My August lock is like 3 feet away but it kept giving poor bluetooth connection. Tried in multiple locations. I had to connect it to an extension cord and put it on a high stool, practically less than a feet away from the lock to get a good bluetooth connection, not even excellent. I was so frustrated I was about to return it. However it still does what it is supposed to do even with poor bluetooth connection. So, we decided to keep it.

it has to be ridiculously close to the lock to function. I tried plugging it into an outlet about 12-13 feet away, and it was spotty. moved it to an outlet 5 feet away and works like a champ. connecting the bridge via the app is a little clunky, need to improve the directions.  Not a fan of the connection button being on the face of the bridge. Being that the bridge had to be so close to the lock, I had to plug it in at a lower outlet. My toddler was able to push the button and interrupt the connection to the lock. this should be engineered to have a cover or something to prevent accidental interruption.

I could never get this to work.  I contacted August support several times about the issue, but never got a good or any response from them.  The concept is a good one, but August still has some work to do in their programming I think.  I ended up selling this to someone else and am now using a keypad lock instead, which works just as it should.  No need for me to worry if I or a trusted friend can get into my house when they need to now.

I should have listened to the other reviews before I bought this. The device needs to be practically next to the August  lock in order to get a Bluetooth signal. Even then, I was rarely able to get it to open or close remotely. Very disappointing and I ended up returning it. I will just have to wait to upgrade my entire August lock at some point.

Did not expect to need this device. We bought the August Lock thinking we could operate it with our Zigbee hub from Echo Show. Wrong!The August Lock requires Z-Wave hub. Info was a little misleading. Had to buy the Z-Wave hub from August Lock.

I have this so I can remotely unlock my August smart lock.  It is only 8' away in the hallway, but connection is weak.  It takes several seconds for it to connect to the lock from the app.  I wonder if the internal connector is u.fl and could be replaced with a u.fl to sma connector so a 2.4ghz dipole antenna could be added externally to improve the range?  I may crack it open some day and find out.

Emits a high pitched screeching noise.  You can hear it when you get close.  Drove our dog mad, we thought he had something wrong with him because he would not calm down for about a week.  Then we unplugged this thing and he is back to his normal calm self.

I was having trouble connecting my door lock to Alexa so I called support and that was the answer I got.  Unfortunately I can't do both so I can't operate the lock outside the house, but I did get connected to Alexa.
The only problem that I have is keeping it close enough to the door for a connection. It would be nice if it only had to be 20’ or so.
Extremely easy to use from anywhere in the world operates in seconds and dependable however formidable to install that being said I buy a 100

Connection is slow and weak. Mine was 6 feet from the smart lock and lost connection. Manual says it needs to be within 10 feet to secure a connection.Moved closer with an extension cable to about 3 feet and it works much better and responds faster.

Bought smart lock, key pad and connect. Smart lock and key pad work as expected. But could not make Connect work properly. Connect setup was ok using my cellphone. Though it can connect to smart lock, its bluetooth signal strength is poor. I have 3 power outlets around front door, ranging from 5 feet to 12 feet. No matter where I plug in the Connect, its bluetooth connection to smart lock is poor. Will test it several more days. If no improvement, I'll return it.
Dont try to save a dollar with less expensive solution. Get ALL August products and I guarantee you will be happy! The installation videos make it all fool proof!

I use the august lock for my rental properties as well as some renovation properties.  Nice to know I don't have my security compromised with potential extra keys out there.  Also having a log of those entering and exiting the property is very handy.  Very easy to issue access through their app.  Highly recommend.

It works, but it was a chore to find an outlet near enough to the door to get a decent Bluetooth signal to the Smart Lock AND get the wifi signal (the router is about 15 feet away).Also, it would be nice if they made the devices recognizable to Alexa so you can directly voice command it open and closed rather than having Alexa ask the August skill to open or close the lock, it would make it a lot more simple. Fingers crossed they simplify this soon. #firstworldproblems

I think I like this addition to the August lock, so long as it continues working properly. It permits locking and unlocking while away from home, as well as monitoring the status of the lock remotely. However, during the first few days that it was up and running the door kept spontaneously unlocking, which shook my confidence in the product. It has since had a firmware update, and seems to be working perfectly now.

Turns your August smart lock into a truly smart lock. Without it you can't unlock your door remotely or using a smart speaker so what's the point. Not the cheapest option but the only option for renters and worth the price IMO.

Works great. I have a plug by my front door so I didn't have any issues with connectivity. My router is also near by in the front room.  I read other reviews where people experienced issues, but I haven't had those issues. Alexa can unlock the door if I'm in the kitchen and I'm expecting someone.

I own a vacation rental cottage in Paris, AR and live in TX.  This allows me to remotely open and lock the doors for guests, if needed, or to just check to ensure they lock up when they leave.  Really gives me 'peace of mind'.  The only 'negative' I could say is that you have to place it close to the lock in order for it to work properly, so be sure you have a plug close to the lock for use.

I like the wireless feature..goes through batteries fast ..uses 4 AA every month. But, my wife loves Amazon, so we do receive a lotbof packages. We also have 2 boys that go on and alot and have auto lock feature turned on.

The setup was really easy. The app works well for the most part. There are times when it is slow to load or you have to tap on the home button to get it to refresh. The auto-unlock doesn't work well for meI have it set up on a detached garage door, so I think the door is too far away to connect with Bluetooth even when I'm home.

I really love the August bridge. The convenience of being able to lock and unlock the door without a key is awesome. Especially when working outside, jogging or walking the dog. Priceless is controlling the lock from a different location via WiFi.

Got this installed and setup in less then 30 min. Tried it once and thought, this is fantastic. Went to try again to show the wife and it would not connect. Took 10 min before it synced up again. No way am I sitting 10 min outside my house waiting for this to sync so I can get in.Not worth the aggravation.
Sometime in the summer of 2020 August bricked the connects, I tried multiple units, different routers and found other people online with the same issues.

Fairly easy setup and so far (1 week) has been reliable. Not impressed at all with the fact that each lock needs a bridge and the bridges need to be plugged into a receptacle fairly close to each lock. There has to be a better way!

August connect is about 4 feet from the lock and the Bluetooth connection is bad. I replaced the batteries on the lock with lithium batteries and no luck Bluetooth connection is still bad. I purchased the connect and I've had it for one day now we'll see how it works with a bad Bluetooth connection but I'm about ready to return the lock and the connection. I will update this review in a few days I'll let you know if I had to return everything or not.

Works but not quite perfect. I have fiber running into the house and sometimes this thing has a difficult time talking to the August. It's good, don't get me wrong; but far from perfect. I would say it works 80% of the time, that extra 20 is concerning when you're worried if the door is locked or not. A good reply would be the "ever lock" feature, but that feature i would say works about 75% of the time.Go for it, just know this won't give you 100% peace of mind.

Ok at first this thing sucked.  For 6 months it was a brick on the wall and only worked %50 of the time.  Since then there's been a firmware update in the locks and now this thing is awesome!  It works every time.  I've used it from 1000 miles away to unlock my door for a friend over the internet.  Awesomesauce.

Fantastic product as I’ve had friends text me to get in my place. Amazing for things like pet sitting as you can give friends and family temp access or unlock it from wherever you are if they are having issues with service or the app
My experience has been great! Just follow the directions on the app, and you are set! I can open and close my door remotely from where ever I am. Am so excited!

I absolutely love this product!  Having the ability to lock my door from anywhere or whenever I (or the kids) forget is awesome!  It was practically ready right out of the box, no complications (plug and play). Outstanding product (along with the August lock!).

Remote control for a smart lock is a must and while August should have released this with the lock itself, better late than never!So does it work? For the most part, yes. I received my Connect within the first week of release, went to set it up, and instantly ran into an issue. My phone could not connect to the... Connect. For such a simple product, I couldn't believe it wasn't working out of the box. I called August support and ran through a lot of troubleshooting. It ended up resulting in the Connect still not working and me waiting about 2 hours for an email back.

The wifi bridge is 10-15 feet from the wifi, less than 5 ft from the deadbolt and yet it always takes a while to reconnect often has issues connecting at all so I have to recalibrate while holding packages or groceries, and it almost NEVER automatically opens when I arrive home.

I would not recommend this product to anyone. The app and auto open stops working at the worst times. Customer support is also horrible. You never hear back when you provide feedback. Connectivity issues all the time.

Feb 13, 2018Works as expected most of the times. My Connect is plugged in very close to the door (less than a feet) and have an excellent WiFi signal at that spot. Takes time when you try to connect remotely. Sometimes you have to turn on/off the 'Remote Connect' button few times to connect to the lock. Most of the times, you have to wait 30 seconds for the app to connect remotely to the lock.

Would be nice if this could connect to multiple locks....have 3 outside doors at my house and have an august dead bolt lock on all of them...trying to upgrade our smart home and security but this is just annoying...spent so much on the locks and this and to only have it be able to pair with one is absolutely ridiculous. Might return everything and look for something else, just isnt doing what I need it to do.
Bridge is constantly disconnecting and is pretty much useless and it makes sure to notify me every time its being a jerk.

The first bridge that I received would not connect to the WiFi and lock at the same time. I requested a replacement and received it right away (before I had returned the faulty one). The new bridge installed quickly and works great. I love being able to check on the lock and operate it from anywhere.
All the reviews say it is easy to install but i paid for two units th hat are either both defective or something is weird with my network. Tried numerous times to connect to the network yet.
It’s amazing! Follow the directions, make sure you have batteries and a good WiFi Signal. The best lock addon I have had.

I do not use it in auto mode to open and close the lock, that was not what I needed. I do use the remote access to open the door to allow people access when ever I need to no matter where I am without giving them a key and that is exactly what I needed.  It is working perfectly for my needs.

I’m on my 2nd generation of August locks for two houses and in every case, they work great. The key to that is the August Bridge.When the August Pro locks came out, I went ahead a purchased two for my house. The features added into the August Pro, such as auto-lock and -unlock, and door-sense proved just too convenient to live without, so I recently replaced the older August locks on my office without august Pros. Key in their use is the bridge.

It is a good idea for August lock to have a wifi connected feature. Can unlock it remotely. The August connect is nice but it has to be plugged in cannot be hardwired to router. Servers are not a hundred percent reliable yet I have had a few issues but it's getting figure it out I guess great customer service.
I followed all instructions but still could not connect it to my WiFi. Found a lot of complains on Internet about this bridge after that

First we purchased the August Smart Lock.  After spending 45 minutes on phone with a service tech, he told us it was defective and we returned and got a working replacement.  Once we realized that only one person could have remote lock access, we then bought this Wi-Fi Bridge so both my wife and I could provide remote unlocking access.with our iPhones.  After spending 30 minutes with another service tech, he told us this unit was defective and to replace it.  We are not going to replace it.  We originally avoided buying a iPad that would also provide the Wi-fi features we wanted, but it was a $300 plus expense we were trying to avoid.  But due to the poor August product quality (not tech service), we will no longer buy their products until their quality improves.  We will buy an iPad instead..

Easy setup. Have used it for 3 months and automatically operates the door lock entrance from the garage every time I approach it. Very convenient to pull in the car with a load of shopping bags and not have to fumble for the key. I use this with the August Smart Lock, 3rd Gen and have it paired with Google Home and Alexa. Works on and off. It has to be reeeeaaaallly close to the August lock for it to work and be reeeeeaallly close to wifi and even then it sometimes doesn't work. Got the August Connect, when I’m already using HomeKit to unlock the August Locks. It actually took a second longer than HomeKit (1-2 seconds, as I have 2 locks) and it only pairs with 1 August Lock!

As others have pointed out the signal strength between the connect and the lock is extremely week. I ended up having the connect less than 6 feet from the lock with no obstructions, and the signal was still listed as weak. It appears that there is an expectation that the connect is plugged in right next to the door.Even with a poor connection it works more than 95% of the time on the first attempt.

I have installed August Wi-Fi bridge close to the lock and it works without any issues. Set up was very easy too.I've used it for two month by now and there wasn't a single hick up yet. Great Product!

The only problem is that it needs to be really close to the lock.... Like really close 😒 took me 15 minutes to figure that out, and the wifi connection to the bridge is horrible. It's 2018, and really the wifi bridge should come with the lock or at least have a 5Ghz wifi connection

Works as advertised. I have this connected to my August lock and then to Wink. I just wished that the lock connected directly to the wink Hub instead of having to buy this bridge. But over all works just as advertised. Have been using this for a few weeks now.

5 STARS! LOVE BEING ABLE TO OPEN MY SMART LOCKS FROM ANYWHERE IN TBE WORLD. GREAT ADD ON TO YOUR AUGUST SMART LOCK. IF YOU CAN BUY THE BUNDLE OF SMART LOCK & THE CONNECT - DO IT & SAVE $$$. IF YOU ALREADY HAVE YOUR LOCK, OH WELL - THIS IS STILL A GREAT ADD ON FOR REMOTE CONTROL OF YOUR LOCK FROM ANYWHERE VIA WIFI.

I tried so many different locks for the multiple rental homes we have. This is by far the best. I control everything from my phone, from the door of the building, or from a keypad. It is great

Product works exactly as advertised.  Very easy setup.  Setup time took a few minutes of waiting but once setup...have not had a single hiccup.  It does take 10-15 sec to connect when initiating wifi connection away from home but is not a problem and now makes it extremely easy to give one time entrance to people that don't need everyday access, maintenance requests and also for people who are not tech savvy because inviting someone and sending them a key to use at the door can be a lil cumbersome.  This makes it easy for me tell them call me when your outside and I unlock it.
