We’ve been using this lock for several years now and it is great, I highly recommend! It looks like a normal lock on the outside which I like. The app works great and it can also be controlled by our Amazon Alexa. Very reliable and looks good too.

It is a nice addition to the smart lock which gives you the ability to unlock the door remotely but for some reason it takes very long time to send commands to the lock, it takes almost 10 seconds to connect to the lock and show the status and 10 more seconds to send the lock/unlock command to the lock. If using bluetooth without the bridge, the commands are sent almost instantly.

To be useful, one must be able to connect to my August lock remotely, reliably. When attempting to connect to our August lock via the Connect, I am successful approximately one out of three times. The Connect also seems to have trouble with Wi-Fi and Bluetooth signal to our router/lock, which shouldn't be, since my phone signal registers as very strong in that location. Finally, there are some design quirks - you need one Connect per lock, instead of one Connect per home, and, importantly, only one person can see the lock state at a time, meaning if my wife and I try to look at the lock status at the same time, like if there's someone at the door, connection will fail for one of the two of us.

It could be faster when working with 2nd generation. It’s also pretty much required to have full control over August lock. I think it should come with it, thats why I give it 4 stars, that and it can be slow to respond even with excellent signal and speed. I recommend it to buy and expect they will improve this with future designs.

First off, this device is not perfect, but what device is!? That is what I call brilliant and just the whole ease of installation made this purchase a no brainer for me in my apartment.  I use IOS and Android so I am quite aware of the app differences and how the Android app just does not even come close to competing with it's IOS equivalent, but until someone is willing to do something about it then why complain??  I actually e-mailed August to see if I could possibly beta test for them so that they could get out a better performing Android app out there to the public and have it work like it should.  The problem is that IOS and Android don't have the same hardware standards and IOS has had low power bluetooth ever since the iPhone 4s but there are still Android devices that are coming out now that don't have this feature set and that's why we have the problem that we do with the lack of features on the Android app.  Also, if you want to put your faith into ANY electronic device to open your home up before you are in a arms length range then you go for it, but I won't turn on that feature just because it has not been that accurate for me and I understand why!  It's not the maker of the August connect or even the lock, it's the technology being used that's not ready for that feature.  I am happy with being able to remote unlock my door as I am approaching my home or just sitting in my car an extra second if I have lots of things to carry so that I can be 100% sure that my door is unlocked and I don't have to fumble with a key.  For that, I love this setup!  Thanks August!

So I own the 2nd generation August Lock which is the equivalent to the 3rd generation (latest) August Lock Pro which comes with the August connect. I bought he August Lock 2nd generation as soon as I found out it was Apple HomeKit compatible. So the August Lock. I give that about a 3.5 stars. Previously before August made their latest updates it was at least 4 stars. It would do as it should. It would lock and unlock with the app or automatically if you were approaching the house and were within range if that’s how you had it set. It wouldn’t connect 100% of the time but it would 80-90% of the time if using WiFi connected to an Apple TV or iPad that permanently stays at home that you use as your module. Sometimes it would lose connection and you would have to wait to connect and then it would connect and would work. But if you were within 20’ it would unlock and lock the door a 100% of the time because it was using Bluetooth. The reason I’m telling you this is after some software updates either on August or iOS 11 and me relocating my Apple TV to the basement I was only able to connect with August Lock to unlock and lock the door 30-50% of the time. Which is definitely not good! So why am I talking about August Lock first and not the connect. It’s because I thought due to me moving Apple TV I bought it needed a closer connection device to August Lock so I got the August connect thinking that it would help. But unfortunately I learned it has not. I literally a waste of money. When I setup the August Connect which is like 6-7’ away from the August Lock at the outlet closest to it which is on the same wall. I kept disconnecting and I didn’t know why. I looked at the settings and my WiFi said great connection but Bluetooth said poor connection. I reached out the August and they said I should install the August connect facing the August Lock at the closest outlet less than 7’ away. That’s ridiculous because this is Bluetooth not an IR connector like a remote control and tv. It should connect within 30’ any direction even through walls. But the fact that I was told thatade me realize the support person responding has no idea about Bluetooth and should be trained better. So I escalated this matter to another customer support agent/Manager. They responded and went through checklist and asked about my WiFi and I said I have a whole house mesh router at a 1gb connection so WiFi is great. Then he did a diagnose of the Bluetooth and said it’s not the August connect it’s the signal from the lock. I said then what? I basically got an okay is that all you need? Can we help you with anything else! Really? No hey send us the August Connevt back and we refund your money, or send us the lock so we can try and diagnose it or better let’s send you a new one to make sure yours it’s not defective. Nope. Nothing. This is when I wished Apple made all these devices because for the most part they try and fix things when broken and make things work the first time before putting them into the marketplace. I digress. This isn’t about Apple. This is about my August Lock and I wanted to buy more of these for other locks around my house and recommend them to others but I don’t think I can in this current state. Hope this will help some of you before you purchase this August connect or even the August Lock. I was thinking about switching to another lock but haven’t found anything else I want yet. I guess I’m hoping August will own up to their fault issue and fix my lock. They will focus on not just tying to come out with new products and sell but perfect the ones they have and make their current customers happy!

I bought this sucker halfway expecting I'd need to ship it back shortly after receiving it -- given all the reviews on here about problems getting the Connect to, well, connect to home wifi networks as well as with the Smart Lock itself -- but the number of problems I've had with it is precisely *zero*. I didn't have to engage in any elaborate "trickery" to get it working, e.g. moving my wifi router around to various locations in order to maintain a connection. Despite said router being separated from the Connect unit by 20 feet and multiple walls (plus my router's located at the bottom of my bedroom closet - long story), the Connect detected it on the first try, and I've had 100% uptime since then. Also haven't had any problems with locking or unlocking the door with my phone from any given location (the Apple HomeKit app on my iPhone works perfectly with it).I can't explain why I've had zero problems while other folks have had plenty, but I'll note that I have an unusually good router as well as exceptionally good internet service: I lucked out and ended up living somewhere with Google Fiber, its gigabit-speed ISP. In practice its connection speed is "only" about 450Mbps most of the time, but still: it's seriously quick, and could explain why my particular August setup has been problem-free. OTOH the Connect is plugged in directly underneath a Google Nest thermostat, which is explicitly *not* compatible with Apple HomeKit (but also connects to my Google-supplied wifi router without problem). So who knows - maybe I lucked out.

I could write down my saga with trying to get my smart lock to work, but here is the gist.  I DO NOT recommend an August smart lock, but that review will go under that product- suffice it to say I am not pleased. This device is used to connect the "smart" lock (which you will have already doled out 200 hundred bucks for) to the internet. Yes, you read that correctly, the smart lock itself is not actually internet-connected without buying this expensive dongle. Otherwise its just a fancy deadbolt. The Connect bridge only allows you to connect one lock, so if you have more than one door in your house, you have to shell out hundreds of dollars to connect them all. According to installation instructions, the bridge needs to be within 30 feet of the lock; according to reality, it needs to be within 5 feet, so if you don't have an outlet IMMEDIATELY ADJACENT to your door, it will not connect. Finally, if you use an Android phone, it will almost never connect to the device, you will have to close and open the app numerous times, and re-start the installation several times from scratch.  This device is also not compatible with Google Wifi, and presumably other "mesh" networks, as it needs to connect to a specific access node, and it is often impossible to determine which one you are connecting to, and all of them will have the same name in the list of nearby networks.In summary: if you have an Android device, or a Google Wifi, or more than one door in your home, or a long distance between your door and nearest indoor power outlet, you will have a bad time.  The iOS version of the app seems to work A LOT better, but alas, that does not work for me.

What I love most about this was the time our oldest forgot his phone.  He called us from a friends phone as he was being dropped off to tell us he was home but couldn't get in. The only thing I do not like is there is no geofence for locking the door. I don’t want it to auto lock every time door opens and closes and I don’t want it on a timer. I didn’t get the Bluetooth keypad which I think I may that way if I’m leaving the house and not just staying in the yard I can just hit a button as pass out door rather then pull phone out and have to manually go into app to lock. IFTTT does not work for setting it to lock for crossing an area but it is compatible for other recipes. I purchased this lock because it tells you the door is not only locked, but that it is CLOSED also. It has been invaluable in providing tenant and technician access to the space when I am unavailable. I am completely satisfied.

Straight forward step by step installation guide from the app, and you can keep the outside part of the original lock as well as the key. It’s essentially an upgrade enabling smart control of the deadbolt

I have used WiFi locks before but this one is the best by far. Easy to use and install. The auto lock works extremely well. The identification unlock/lock is very unique and should be integrated into ALL WiFi locks. The WiFi bridge took a little bit to connect but once connected I haven’t had any issues with it. This lock works great! I heard some people complaining about battery life of the lock and the keypad but I have no complaints so far! The lock itself is pretty big so it’s not the prettiest thing to have on your door but the more important thing is that it works and is reliable!

August is a company who has impressed me with its Smart Lock for home automation. The August Smart Lock started with only the option to use Bluetooth to unlock your door. This meant you had to be within a certain range to open your door. This is actually a great feature because if power goes out you can still lock and unlock your door. August even lets you send invites to people you would like to let in your home while you are away. Unfortunately, there is a downside. What if the person you send the invite to doesn’t have a smartphone?The great team at August thought about this and came up with the solution – a small adapter called the Connect. “With August Connect, August is expanding the range of functionality for our users, delivering new experiences around secure, intelligent access to the home,” said Jason Johnson, CEO and co-founder of August. “While the existing Bluetooth connectivity in the August Smart Lock allows it to be a truly offline, independent device, August Connect enhances that core offering with new benefits such as real time and WiFi Internet connectivity.”

I had an older smart lock and it was pretty inconsistent and I was getting frustrated.  However, this August lock has been a breath of fresh air!  This allows me to pick and unlock from anywhere I have a cell or wifi connection.  It's great for having constat awareness and provides me a level of comfort that I did not have with my previous smart lock.

I love the bridge because of its simplicity and usefulness. We have a large home with 4 of them installed. I can check to see if all my doors are locked using Siri and I can open my doors from anywhere in the world as long as I’m connected to WiFi.

I have had this product for over 5 months now and have been in love with it everyday. Hi especially like the auto lock feature for if I leave a certain distance from my house door will automatically lock. I also really like that it shows you when the door opens and closes and or who it is opened or closed by if it is used by someone you gave a virtual door key to. I would recommend and I do recommend this product to any/everyone. The installation process is so easy that even a young child could set it up for you.

Great product. Easy to install and good directions. I had no idea which lock I had but the universal hardware ended up working. My only complaint is parts of the unit could look, feel and actually be more durable than they are. If someone like a guest turns the lock further than it should go I bet.it would break fairly easily. It is very awesome to be able to lock and unlock your smart lock from anywhere. Also to give anyone access to do the same.

I've had the lock, WiFi bridge and keypad (by the way, I recommend all three if your going to do this) for over a year now. Installation was a breeze and everything works as expected. I've tried other products but this one works the best and send to have the largest support for integration. I'm essentially a Smart things and Google home house for the control side, hue, bhyze, harmony, nest, ring, ect. For everything else. I can control the August from the harmony remote, shady things fridge, Google home (voice or that new display thing) all without pause. I do wish the batteries lasted longer but if you think about it you lock and unlock your door often in a day (at least we do) and it is literally a motor physically rotating a deadbolt back and forth. That takes some energy. Plus you get plenty of warning time to swap them out. Buy rechargables.  - Shaun C.

Easy to install and works fine. I will recommend this to others. Before you install, check if your existing dead bolt os working or not. One of my friend has non working deadbolt and also door alignment issue which required him to fix it first before installing august lock. Also integration with google assistant is not native but thru explore menu. I wish they offer native integration. Currently youcan not unlock door using google home, but you can get status and lck it. It works fine with homekit and siri.

The concept of the August Lock and bridge are promising; however, the lock fails to deliver consistently enough to be a reliable and convenient resource in my home. I'd say the feature of unlocking the door when I'm in proximity of the lock works about 50% of the time. When it doesn't work you have to fumble for your phone, open the app, and manually unlock - I might as well have keys at this point. I've found that connected locks with a key pad offers a more convenient, consistent experience.

Love it!!!  We use it for our Airbnb and it has made life easier.  Recommend this lock.  We have high speed internet there and we haven't had any issues.  When  wifi updates it goes offline for a few but then reconnects.  I can set code for door and length of time that code will work for each guest. Text each guest the code for them to check in.  Also can open remotely for cleaners and repair workers.  Love it! Love it! Love it!

Ever since we installed the product we haven’t had to worry about carrying keys with us. And with features like auto lock, we can be worry free that the door stays locked even if we forget to lock it. And more important we didn’t have to switch to a new set of keys and the system works as an add-on to existing lock set. Well designed and well thought out product. Highly recommended

Smartest purchase ever. We have a place in Nola that we aren’t at all the time. We are happy to let friends and family use it, but we wanted a better solution than managing ‘who has the keys’. This works beautifully. We can give people temporary access to the door and it has never failed us once.

So far what can I say ... I talk to Alexa and my door locks itself and gives me status when I'm to lazy to take a few extra steps. All told the August works as advertised for the most part and solves a few nuisances of traditional door locks.  For me this helps when I lay down to go to sleep and think "did I lock the door?" Doesn't matter now dinner I can check or lock it without getting back out of bed. Recently I went away for a couple days and issued ACCESS to a family member through the app which is so much nicer than having to find a extra key or get one made. What doesn't seem to work as well is the auto unlock feature. Sometimes I walk up to the door with my hands full and I don't have to dig for keys, and the other half of the time I expect it worked, but I have to put everything down and dig out my keys.  Overall pretty pleased

READ THIS REVIEW!! For a sound assessment of why August is a good company with some good products of which this ABSOLUTELY IS NOT ONE!!  The August Connect is easily worth $20 as a novelty or as proof of concept, but at its actual price is a complete rip off. You WILL be dissatisfied.OMG!!  Absolute, 1st degree POS!!  Tried to set it up less than 5 feet from my lock and could not get it to work, due to poor Bluetooth connectivity.  Well, August suggests trying to make sure the connect is facing upwards and mine was facing sideways in an outlet expander.  Removed the outlet expander and plugged connect in alone and upright; no difference.  August suggests trying different outlets (even if a little further away) in the general vicinity.  I tried it at twelve feet, I tried it at 15 feet, with direct line of sight; No difference, no difference.  I tried resetting and starting from scratch at 5 ft upright, resetting and starting from scratch at 12 ft, resetting and starting from scratch at 15 ft with line of sight; No difference, no difference, no difference.

How can the connectivity be soooooo baaaaadThe gateway couldn't be closer to the lock.  And $400 some odd dollars for something that I can't rely on to let me into my home and keep others out?  Nowhere near ready for primetime.

Works great. Home kit is a bit slow. The bridge is troublesome to get connected. Probably why they came out with the new model with wifi built in. This model is a bit less expensive. Happy with myChoice.

Works great. I bought the HomeKit lock thinking it would work remotely. It did until they came out with The August Pro lock. My advice.......Buy the cheap lock and this and forget the ‘Pro’ with it’s worthless IMHO ‘Door Sensing’ crap. But, this works great so 5 Stars.

Works great and every time unlock/ locked or even door is open I get notification!And I can give access Permission for guest without sharing master log in info.

This ones not perfect, but definitely one of the better ones ive owned. Only issue is when you update the app and need to sign back in.

Super convenient, and easy to install! Would recommend to everyone.Took 5 minutes to install and it’s easy to give people access to the lock without giving them a physical key. Much safer than hiding a key under the doormat.

I love this thing! Installation was a snap. Set up for Bluetooth and and other sitting took about another five minutes. Overall I am quite happy with the August Smartlock (3rd gen) and I would highly recommend it!

This is a great product to have. It makes it hands free to unlock and lock the door. Installation is very easy. I have attached pictures of my entry door, inside and outside of the door. Overall, a great product!!!The only issue I came across was the feature that automatically locks the door upon your exit. I have since installed the keypad which always me to lock the door with the push of a button. Problem solved!

Very easy to install and operate. Individual lock codes is very handy when you have to let multiple people in your house while you aren’t home ie cleaning people ect. It is very modern looking so you may or may not like the way it looks depending on your style. I like a traditional/rustic look but I didn’t mind it’s appearence after a day or so.

So easy to operate and works every time. I can use my iPhone or my Apple Watch to lock or unlock which is super convenient.
I was nervous about this purchase as I always read the one star reviews first, but I have had this for almost a year now and the lock and bridge are awesome. Best money I spent in 2019!

I love this extra addition to our home from the August. This bridge is need to be able to have Alexa make sure your door is locked and this is the only way to unlock, lock and to make sure your door is locked while you’re away from the home.

It’s a bit bulky, other than that it was easy to install, the connectivity is great, and the features like auto lock and unlock work seamlessly. I love coming to my door and it unlocks for me automatically, no fumbling for my keys. Also, I can let the delivery guy or family members in from work. Totally awesome.
I love this lock! I installed it in less than 20 minutes. It unlocks when I get home and I no longer have to deal with my key that is pain. Although I can use my existing key if I need to.
I absolutely love the August wi-fi bridge and lock. I haven’t had any issues with this lock. I’ve tried a few others but for the price this one beats them hands down

This app is great , allow me see everytime the door unlocked and everytime is open, and detect my phone Bluetooth and will often not always unlock automatically  when I am close to the door. Most importantly allow me to lock and unlock even when I am 100 miles away from home.

Love, love, love our August WiFi Bridge that allows us to remotely check the status of our front door lock. We bought the lock & bridge because we got home from a week in Hawaii to find we had left our front door unlocked. (Nothing missing, thank God.) Now I can check my lock--such peace of mind.

Getting close to your August lock is important, but if you can find a good location it makes the lock much more manageable.  This is really a must have add-on. We been using it for about 1.5 years with no problems locking and unlocking. We liked that is has a set timer if we forget to manually locked it then it will lock on its own.  Since getting this lock I never have to worry about having my keys in hand to come into my home. I recommend this product.

The August Connect to August Lock blue tooth works for me, but only within 3 ft of door lock.  This is odd because my iPhone bluetooth connection will lock/unlock the door within 20 ft. I purchase this device Dec 2018 as a Christmas present.

I can't believe how easy this lock works. I can let anyone into the house when I'm gone. It locks when I leave. It's always connected. Very happy with this purchase. Can't wait to get locks for every door in the house.

I purchased this from August directly, not from Amazon, to add to my August Smartlock. Its unfortunate the experience a couple other reviewers have had on here with this product, my experience has been quite different. I love this add-on to the lock itself and it not only setup extremely easy, but has worked very well and I really like being able to verify the lock is engaged when I am away or be able to remote lock and unlock the door. My experience with the SmartLock itself has been equally great. I use the geofencing to lock and unlock the door the most. When I first got the lock that feature was still in beta and there were occasions it did not unlock when I arrived home (I always used the app to manually lock the door since the feature was in beta)..but often this would happen after I had restarted the phone. If I remembered to launch the app after doing so, it always seemed to work well, especially after the latest batch of updates.The Connect, in my opinion, takes a great product and makes it even better. But, keep in mind, there are a lot of variables at play here...technology isn't perfect...wireless communication isn't perfect...life isn't perfect. I mean COME ON people...you can unlock your door with your freakin phone...its pretty amazing where this technology of home automation is heading. Keep in mind, those of us who have taken the plunge are the early adopters...we will be the ones who help smooth out the rough edges...as time goes on the tech will improve.

Guys, perhaps you were like me excited to get into the whole remote controlling your lock wherever you are especially if you are running an Airbnb business. I did, and got the smartlock and connect. After 3 months of back and forth with August Support team I have finally thrown in the towel. Here is my experience:In my first month, I had yet to install home broadband at my apartment and so I was using a spare phone to act as a wifi hotspot to link the smartlock and connect to the internet. Remote operation worked in this 1 month but not in the way that you think. Firstly, the connection at the connect may fail for no reason and although August says the connect will auto reset itself, this is simply unacceptable as you have no idea when it will reset and not when your Airbnb guest is waiting at the front door! I got an adapter which turns the connect on and off every 15 minute intervals to offset this unreliability and this worked for me although if your guests happened to have missed the 15 minute gap when it was on, they will have to wait for 15 minutes.
I never use keys anymore!

The August Wi-Fi connect is just horrible. I connected it to the lock no problem but trying to add it to google home was just a nightmare. Added the device in google home and it did not work. Removed it from google home and tried to add it again, nothing. Did not even show up anymore but said it was successful. After hours of trying to unlink and link it in google home. I decided to reinstall the august connect from the reset to pairing it to the lock again. Bingo the device finally decided to show up in google home. Tried to contact august and spent 1.5 hours on hold with no one answering. Just gave up. There is no customer service. Be WARNED !!!!!!! you are on your own.

A little slow at times but that could be dependent on the network (I run 75mbs connection).

I purchased the August Smart Lock bundled with August Connect, after a year the August Connect completely stopped working.  I purchased a replacement, and product worked for a few days and then stopped working again.  This is poor quality control.  the Smart Lock itself a  ood product, no issues connecting to it via Bluetooth, but unfortunately I will need to find another option as I need to be able to remotely unlock my door from time to time.  Very disappointed.  Will be shipping this back and finding a new product.

The geo-lock/unlock setting is great, but you do have to tap the wifi icon on the app as you're getting close which sorta defeats the purpose of it.  Connectivity is ok, not fantastic, but acceptable. Installing it was a breeze and it paired with the lock in no time. This is a nice addon, but I think down the road, the functionality of the Connect should just be added right into the lock.

Over all the August Lock Is a solid investment that is easy to setup and allows you to keep your physical keys. If you have little ones in the house the Door sensor alerting you to open doors is a god send. It works with both Google Home and Alexa, and has (limited) integration with IfTTT.There are some things you should be aware of, I don't think they're deal breakers but they are worth taking note of...

Well let me start by saying this is a long review by someone who 99% of the time doesn't bother to write reviews. We recently bought a new home and am wanting to create a smart home ecosystem. By all popular sites this was a good product ( and ecosystem) to invest in. I am a huge tech nerd and computer geek and am well versed in tech.I purchased a Connect Hub, The Smart Lock, and the Doorbell Cam. I purchased the locks as the teenagers can often forget to lock the doors when they leave the house and I figured this would give me peace of mind that the house is always locked even when they forget. It will also unlock when we arrive home so that was pretty cool too. The Auto Lock feature worked well. The auto Unlock feature was completely nonfunctional. After spending over 90 mins on the phone with "August Support" they said the fault lied with the Android platform not communicating with their app and recognizing when we entered the home geofence. Not only was it not auto unlocking but when standing at the door it would take 45 seconds to connect to the lock to unlock the door! How is this faster, smarter, more efficient then using a key? IT ISNT !!!

Changing the review for this product. I gave a fair amount of time to test (6 months) with both iPhone and Samsung, and decided to remove this product (along with the smart lock) as it became very frustrating. Very inconsistent behavior, wait up to 1 min at the door for either the app to connect or to automatically unlock. Button to unlock will randomly freeze, need to restart the app and re-wait for the app to connect. Product does not synchronize when lock/unlock manually, which in turns jam the lock. Lock will unlock and relock for some undetermined reasons at anytime which make this product unreliable and unsafe. Very disappointing! as this product is quite expensive. I do not recommend AT ALL this product.
